citation.article-title: Halomonas alkaliantarctica sp. nov., isolated from saline lake Cape Russell in Antarctica, an alkalophilic moderately halophilic, exopolysaccharide-producing bacterium

p.s: Description of H. alkaliantarctica sp. nov.

H. alkaliantarctica (al.ka.li.an.tarc’ti.ca. Arabic word alkali, al-qaliy) the ashes of saltwort; L. adj. antarcticus -a -um, southern, Antarctic; N.L. fem. adj. alkaliantarctica; related to the ability to grow at pH alkaline and isolated from Antarctica).
Alkalitolerant and halotolerant microorganism of domain Bacteria.
They are Gram-negative, aerobic and lack endospores.
Colonies on medium A were creamy, smooth and circular.
It is mesophilic exhibiting optimum growth temperature of 30 °C, but is able to grow between 10 and 37 °C.
It presents an optimum pH at 9.0, a pH range of 7.4–9.6 and it tolerates up to 22.2% NaCl.
It is able to grow on sucrose, glucose, galactose, ribose, fructose, trehalose, sodium acetate, maltose, cellobiose, lactic acid, glycerol when the medium was supplemented with 50 μg/l of thiamine.
It is oxidase, nitrate reduction and indole production positive, but negative with respect to catalase, casein, starch and gelatine hydrolysis, nitrite reduction.
The strain was able to synthetise α-glucosidase which had a maximum activity at 35 °C and pH 9.0.

Q9 is the only ubiquinone and the predominant polar lipids are phosphatidylglycerol (PG), diphosphatidylglycerol (DPG) and phosphatidylethanolamine (PEA). nC16:0, branched C16:0, C16:1 and C18:1 are the main cellular fatty acids, minor components are nC14:0, branched C15:0 and C18:0.
Strain CRSS accumulates glycine–betaine as major component, ectoine and glutamate as minor osmoprotectants.
The mol% G+C content of DNA is 55.0 mol%, and this species is phylogenetically related to H. boliviensis, H. neptunia and H. variabilis on the basis of 16S rDNA gene sequence.

The following antibiotics inhibited the growth of the strain CRSS: tetracycline (50), chloramphenicol (10), neomycin (30), gentamycin (10), erythromycin (30), streptomycin (25) but it grew in the presence of penicillin G (10), kanamycin (30), nystatin (1 0 0), tylosin (30), lincomycin (15), bacitracin (10), novobiocin (30), neomycin (5), cycloheximide (30), vancomycin (30), fusidic acid (10) and ampicillin (25).
CRSS is able to produce EPS but not PHB. H. alkaliantarctica was isolated from salt in the saline lake Cape Russell.

Type strain CRSS has been deposited in Deutsche Sammlung von Mikroorganismen Collection, Braunschweig, Germany (DSM 15686T) and in American Type Culture Collection, University Boulevard, Manassas, USA (ATCC BAA-848T).
The EMBL accession number for the 16S rDNA sequence of CRSS is AJ564880.
